lead_paragraph: N.F.L. Commissioner Roger Goodell said Michael Vick had paid a significant price for his “egregious mistake” and would have to show genuine remorse and that the experience had changed him to have a chance to resume his career in the league. Goodell appeared at Washington & Lee University, engaging in a panel discussion about leadership in sports and taking questions from the audience. Vick is serving a 23-month prison term after his conviction in a federal dogfighting case and has a team of lawyers trying to settle his finances in bankruptcy court. ¶Southern California Coach Pete Carroll said on his Web site that the sophomore Aaron Corp would be the Trojans’ starting quarterback through the summer and into fall camp. Corp will start Saturday’s scrimmage, with the freshman Matt Barkley as his backup and the junior Mitch Mustain as the No. 3. Carroll said Corp’s starting status was not final. trojans.
